title: iPhone 12 128GB — Like New (Blue)

listingInfo.title: iPhone 12 128GB — Like New (Blue)
listingInfo.disclosedFlaws: Very light scratch on the bottom frame (photo 4), no earphones included
listingInfo.attributes: Blue color, 128GB, iOS 17.xx; Battery ~88% (confirmed in chat)

complaint: Undisclosed screen replacement. Apple Support shows “Display – Genuine Apple Part (Replaced)”.

chatLog.text: Hi, is the phone still available? Same condition as in the photos?
Yes, still available. Same as shown. I’ve kept it in great condition — only a tiny scratch on the lower frame (see photo 4).
What’s the battery health? Any yellow tint or display issues? True Tone okay?
Around 88%, runs smoothly. Screen is fine, True Tone normal.
Has it ever been repaired or had any parts replaced? Face ID works?
Face ID works. Haven’t done any major repairs.
Can you lower the price a bit? I’ve seen some listed around 9.0–9.2k.
I listed 9.5 because it’s in excellent shape. If you confirm now, I can do 9.2.
Okay, 9.2 works. Can we do 7-ELEVEN COD? I’m busy and can’t meet in person.
Sure. Send me your preferred 7-ELEVEN pickup store.
7-ELEVEN Minsheng (Songshan). How much is the shipping?
COD shipping fee is NT$60, paid at pickup.
Okay. Does it come with a charging cable?
No earphones, but I’ll include a third-party cable.
Could you send one photo with a white background and screen brightness ~80% so I can check the display?
(sends photo) Took it under warm indoor light — looks fine.
Looks good. Please create the order on the app.
Will do.
Order created (Order ID: TW-10567).
I’ve shipped it via 7-ELEVEN (ibon). You should get it tomorrow.
Package arrived at 7-ELEVEN Minsheng.
Just picked it up and paid (item + NT$60 COD). Thanks!

I checked and found the screen has been replaced. Apple Support shows “Genuine Apple Part – Display replaced” (see attached screenshot). The listing and chat never mentioned this. I’d like to return the item for a refund.
The screen is genuine Apple, I have the service record. You didn’t ask, so I didn’t bring it up.
A screen replacement — even genuine — is material information that must be disclosed. You also said “no major repairs.” I’m filing a Return/Refund request.

Return/Refund request received. Seller has 24 hours to: Accept / Decline / Counter-offer.

Tip:
• Buyer — please upload Apple Support screenshots & comparison photos.
• Seller — provide Apple service proof if available.
(uploads screenshot showing “Display – Genuine Apple Part (Replaced)” with matching IMEI)
I decline. It’s a genuine screen and you didn’t ask. I don’t see the issue.

Seller has “Declined.” Buyer has 24h to accept an alternative or Raise to Carousell Support.

Tip:
• If you wish to keep the item, consider a Partial refund.
• If you prefer Return & Full, please confirm for case escalation.
I want a Return & Full Refund. Non-disclosure of repair history is misleading. I’ll Raise to Support.
(clicks “Raise to Carousell Support”)

Preliminary finding — SNAD due to non-disclosure.

Recommended:
A) Return & Full Refund (Seller covers NT$60 + return label),
OR
B) Keep & Partial Refund (15–30%) if Buyer chooses to keep.

Please respond within 24h to avoid automatic escalation.
Understood. If that’s the process, I’ll accept Return & Full Refund. I’ll reimburse the NT$60 and send the 7-ELEVEN return label today.
Agreed. I’ll ship it back within 48h, record the packing video, and keep the receipt.
Agreement recorded. System will generate return instructions for Buyer.
